pullRequest.body:
Introduces the zero locus of a set of sections on a ringed space and characterizes nilpotent sections
over compact opens of a scheme in terms of basic opens and the zero locus.

Co-authored-by: Andrew Yang @erdOne 

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]
-->

The `Scheme.eq_of_eq_cover` lemma and the `IsOpenImmersion.ΓIso` related things are due to Andrew.

I'd be happy to move the first two sections of the `Nilpotents` file somewhere else, but I did not find the canonical place.

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

### PR summary [f47d21b577](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/14337/commits/f47d21b577d127ad0260d4383d70c52004f19209)

#### Import changes

No significant changes to the import graph

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ LocallyRingedSpace.toΓSpec_preim_basicOpen_eq`
`+ OpenCover.ext_elem`
`+ Scheme.eq_zeroLocus_of_isClosed_of_isAffine`
`+ Scheme.isNilpotent_iff_basicOpen_eq_bot_of_isCompact`
`+ Scheme.toΓSpec_image_zeroLocus_eq_of_isAffine`
`+ Scheme.toΓSpec_preimage_zeroLocus_eq`
`+ Scheme.zeroLocus_eq_top_iff_subset_nilradical_of_isCompact`
`+ Scheme.ιOpens_appLE_isIso`
`+ Scheme.ιOpens_image_top`
`+ appLE_eq_app`
`+ appLE_invApp`
`+ basicOpen_appLE`
`+ basicOpen_eq_bot_of_isNilpotent`
`+ eqToHom_comp_homOfLE`
`+ eqToHom_comp_homOfLE_op`
`+ homOfLE_comp_eqToHom`
`+ homOfLE_isIso_of_eq`
`+ homOfLE_op_comp_eqToHom`
`+ homeomorph`
`+ image_le_image_of_le`
`+ image_preimage_eq_opensRange_inter`
`+ image_top_eq_opensRange`
`+ instance {X : Scheme.{u}} : Subsingleton Γ(X, ⊥)`
`+ isNilpotent_of_isNilpotent_cover`
`+ map_homOfLE`
`+ map_ΓIso_inv`
`+ opensFunctor_map_homOfLE`
`+ preimage_image_eq`
`+ toΓSpec_preimage_basicOpen_eq`
`+ toΓSpec_preimage_zeroLocus_eq`
`+ zeroLocus_def`
`+ zeroLocus_eq_top_iff`
`+ zeroLocus_iUnion₂`
`+ zero_of_zero_cover`
`+ ΓIso`
`+ ΓIso_hom_map`
`+ ΓIso_inv`
`++ basicOpen_pow`
`++ mem_zeroLocus_iff`
`++ zeroLocus`
`++ zeroLocus_empty_eq_univ`
`++ zeroLocus_isClosed`
`++ zeroLocus_singleton`
`- fromSpec_image_top`
`- toΓSpec_preim_basicOpen_eq`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/no_lost_declarations.sh short <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/no_lost_declarations.sh <optional_commit>
```
</details>

</details>
I ended up moving everything somewhere else, so I removed the new file again.
Thanks again for all the suggestions @erdOne! Adapted them in the latest commit.

Thanks!
maintainer merge
May I ask what this is for?
🚀 Pull request has been placed on the maintainer queue by erdOne.

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9772552847/job/26977111540)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9772552847/job/26977111858)

> Thanks! maintainer merge May I ask what this is for?

This is towards characterizing closed immersions with affine target as quotient maps.

Thanks :tada:

bors merge

Thanks :tada:

bors merge
Maybe use `invApp` to define this (we probably want to wrap that into an iso first). And use `Γ(X, ⊤)` instead of `Scheme.Γ.obj`.
I did. I am wondering if `Scheme.Hom.opensRange f` is the simp NF or `f ''ᵁ ⊤`?
`Scheme.Hom.opensRange f` is good enough. we probably should have a simp `f '' U = opensRange`. btw you could write `f.opensRange`.

```suggestion
lemma Scheme.ιOpens_image_top {X : Scheme.{u}} (U : Opens X) : (Scheme.ιOpens U) ''ᵁ ⊤ = U :=
  U.openEmbedding_obj_top
```
You should use `X.isoSpec.hom.1.base` instead of this.
Then for affine schemes the simp NF of `toΓSpecFun` is `isoSpec.hom.val.base`?
You could say that, but essentially toΓSpecFun is a implementation detail and should not be used outside that file.

In what terms do I state a lemma like this then?
```lean
lemma LocallyRingedSpace.toΓSpec_preim_zeroLocus_eq {X : LocallyRingedSpace}
    (s : Set (X.presheaf.obj (op ⊤))) :
    X.toΓSpecFun ⁻¹' PrimeSpectrum.zeroLocus s = X.toRingedSpace.zeroLocus s := by
```
`(LocallyRingedSpace.toΓSpec X).1.base` I think. Please also provide it in terms of schemes anyway.
Thanks. Maybe `toΓSpecFun` and friends should be private.
Re in terms of schemes: What is the canonical spelling there for the unit of the adjunction for schemes? Do I still write `toΓSpec`?
BTW: `(LocallyRingedSpace.toΓSpec X).1.base` simps to `toΓSpecBase`.
Probably `ΓSpec.adjunction.unit.app X` for now. Or you can define `Scheme.toΓSpec` if you feel like it.

Let me suggest the following: For now I do `ΓSpec.adjunction.unit.app X`, but I propose the following refactor:
- split up the gamma spec adjunction file
- make the constructions private
- add `Scheme.toΓSpec` and restate things in terms of that.
BTW: I think more files can be split, maybe we need some more folders and `Basic` files.
Similarly, use `(𝒰.map).app ⊤` and not `Scheme.Γ`.
And maybe call it `Scheme.OpenCover.ext_elem` mimicking `Basis.ext_elem`.
Please copy this to `AlgebraicGeometry.Scheme` for schemes. The philosophy is, schemes being ringed spaces  is merely a implementation detail, and users won't have to dig into them for API.
This shouldn't be here.
In the sense of "this should not exist" or "this should be moved"?

This should be moved.

I saw the comment in the PR message after reviewing.
Lemmas related to cover can go to `Cover/Open`. 
Lemmas related to basic operations of zero-locus can go to `Scheme.lean`
Behavior of zero-locus on affine schemes can go to `AffineScheme.lean`.
This can go below the def of `ιOpens`.

```suggestion
  exact inferInstanceAs (X.presheaf.map (eqToIso (Scheme.ιOpens_image_top _)).op)
```
Or something similar. Not tested.
I couldn't get this to work, but I golfed my version a bit.
Is `exists_pow_mul_eq_zero_of_res_basicOpen_eq_zero_of_isCompact` related?
Yes, I now conclude this lemma from the one you linked.
Maybe provide `Scheme.Hom.homeomorph` for `[IsIso f]` and use that.

```suggestion
    (s : Set Γ(X, ⊤)) :
```
Can you package this as an iff?
I think this could go below `toΓSpec_preim_basicOpen_eq`.
I don't know what you mean by "below", but I moved it to the GammaSpecAdjunction file where `toΓSpec_preim_basicOpen_eq` is.

```suggestion
lemma Scheme.toΓSpec_preim_zeroLocus_eq {X : Scheme.{u}}
```
Same for other places (for performance reasons)
I think this works for every open set right?
I did generalize it.
Can you provide `ΓIso_inv` as `= f.appLE _ _ sorry`

```suggestion
```
Can you also add `basicOpen_pow`?

```suggestion
/-- An isomorphism of schemes induces a homeomorphism of the underlying topological spaces. -/
```
These also works for arbitrary opens.

```suggestion
of `Γ(X, ⊤)` under `toΓSpec` agrees with the associated zero locus on `X`. -/
```
I'd call this `toΓSpec_preimage_zeroLocus`. I don't think it is standard to use `preim` for preimages in mathlib.
I had mimicked the naming of `toΓSpec_preim_basicOpen`. Now I changed both to `preimage`.

Can you put this below the lemma `app_eq_appLE`?
Also I don't think we should have this as a global simp lemma. 
There are places where `app_eq_appLE` should be simp instead.

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(AlgebraicGeometry): zero locus of sections and characterisation of nilpotent elements
